utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is shaking?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s colloquial, a conversation opener. So, do you find the weather satisfying? Are you currently sharing in the triumph of some local sports team?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s wrong with you? you’re freaking me out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m striking up a casual conversation with you. S’u’up?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Please don’t do that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, But I’m given to understand that when you have something awkward to discuss with someone, it’s more palatable to preface it with banal chit chat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, this wasn’t the awkward part?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, all right. S’u’up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good, I used that right. Anyway, you’re aware that Leonard has entered into a new romantic relationship which includes a sexual component?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, feeling the awkward now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Her name is Dr. Stephanie Barnett and she is a highly distinguished surgical resident at Freemont Memorial.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, Leonard told me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good. What he may have left out is how important this relationship is to me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: To you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, see, of the handful of women Leonard’s been involved with, she’s the only one I have ever found tolerable.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, what about me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The statement stands for itself.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, aren’t you sweet?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Anyway, should you have any interaction with her, it would be most helpful that she not see you as a sexual rival.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I think she’s pretty safe.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You say that now, but consider the following scenario, you’re sitting in your apartment, it’s late, you’re alone, your hypothalamus is swimming in a soup of estrogen and progesterone and suddenly even Leonard seems like a viable sexual candidate, or a, uh, hookup as it’s referred to by today’s urban youth.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Now, should that happen, I would ask you to find some way to suppress your libido.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I could think about you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine, whatever works.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Always nice talking to you, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, peace out!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, this is very pleasant.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m glad you’re enjoying yourself.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And you said there’d never be enough pasta for the three of us.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I stand corrected.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, Italian housewives have a rule of thumb. A handful of dry pasta about an inch in diameter is sufficient for each person as it doubles in volume when cooked.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: That’s very interesting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She doesn’t mean it. She’s just being nice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, Stephanie, since Leonard seems to be dropping the conversational ball, I guess I’ll just have to pick it up. Have you ever witnessed a violent crime?

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good. What’s your favourite fruit?

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Ih-uh, strawberries.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm, technically not a fruit, but all right. Where did you do your medical internship?

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Uh, Lawrence Memorial in Galveston, Texas.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? That’s where I was born!

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: You’re kidding!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I spent so much of my childhood at that hospital. When I was 12, I got to ride there in a helicopter.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Why, what-what-what happened?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Radiation burns. A little mishap while I was building my own cat scanner.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: I’m sorry, you tried to build your own cat scanner?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I didn’t try, I succeeded. In fact, I was briefly able to see the inside of my sister’s guinea pig, Snowball, before he caught fire. It led to an interesting expression in our house, not a snowball’s chance in a cat scanner.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. When I come back, just for fun, the subject will be alternative history. Specifically, how would the civil war have gone differently if Lincoln had been a robot sent from the future? Look at that, there’s even pasta left over.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you understand that this was supposed to be a date?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I do. Do you? Because frankly, you’ve been in a foul mood since I sat down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, here’s my question, why did you sit down?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To help. Look, if you fail at this relationship, and history suggests you will, then we risk losing the medical officer that our landing party has always needed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What landing party?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re Kirk, I’m Spock, Wolowitz is Scotty, Koothrappali is the guy who always gets killed, and now we’ve got McCoy.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: So, we’re all standing around looking at the post-op x ray and there it is, clear as day, right in the guy’s chest cavity, one of my earrings.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, my god, what did you do?

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: What do you think I did? I discreetly slipped off the other earring, put it in my pocket and then got the hell out of there!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (arriving)
utterance.content: I have a bone to pick with you, sir.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oo-oo-oh!

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Hi, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hi, Stephanie. I’m sorry I’m late, but your companion left the most indecipherable invitation.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What invitation?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We’re going to the movies. What movie? What theatre? What time? If you were trying to make it impossible to locate you, you couldn’t have done a better job.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, clearly I could have.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It took me nearly 20 minutes to go through the browser history on your computer to see what movie times you looked up. Wait here, I’ll find us seats.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: No, no, we have seats.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not the right seats.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: What is he doing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He’s finding the acoustic sweet spot.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Does he always do this?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sometimes he brings a toy xylophone. I am really sorry about this.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: No, it’s fine. you know, he’s sweet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My apologies, you’ve been sitting in it all along. Leonard, you want to slide over one?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, just sit here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, this is it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (Knock, knock, knock)
utterance.content: Leonard Leonard Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What, Sheldon? What, Sheldon? What, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (showing him laptop)
utterance.content: Tell me what you see here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The blunt instrument that will be the focus of my murder trial?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is Stephanie’s facebook page. Now, where it should say in a relationship, what does it say?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stephanie Barnett is single.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, furthermore, earlier this evening, she threw a digital sheep at some guy named Mike. Who’s Mike? Why does he get a digital sheep and not you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s just her facebook page and we’ve only been going out a couple of weeks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t see it, do you? We’re losing her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I’m going to make this very simple for you. You are not in this relationship, I am. Ergo, you have no say in anything that happens between me and Stephanie.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m afraid I can’t allow that. Pursuant to Starfleet General Order 104 Section A, you are deemed unfit and I hereby relieve you of your command.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: General Order 104, Section A does not apply in this situation.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Give me one good reason why not.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because this is not Star Trek

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (Knock, knock, knock)
utterance.content: Penny Penny Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is banana bread.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This is a door knob.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s my understanding that an unsolicited gift of food can be a precursor to an impromptu invitation to come in and chat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, would you like to come in?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose I could spare a few minutes. Were you robbed?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How can you be sure?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, what do you want?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m certain this will come as no surprise to you, but Leonard is failing in yet another relationship.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He’s having problems with Stephanie?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She’s sending virtual livestock to random men on the internet. If I have any hope of keeping them together, I need data. Specifically, I need to know exactly what Leonard did that caused you to pop an emotional cap in his buttocks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Again, urban slang. In which, I believe I’m gaining remarkable fluency. So, what is the down and the low? And don’t worry, this is all entirely confidential, so, you feel free to include any and all shortcomings in the bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We never got to the bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, okay, all right, you know what? I’ll tell you what happened. We were young, we were very much in love, but we could only communicate through a time-traveling mailbox at my lake house.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not enough that you made me watch that movie, but now you mock me with it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Gentlemen, I have a question about dating and relationships.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You told me you were going to have the talk with him.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ve been waiting for someone to have the talk with me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: More to the point, it’s about finding a way to keep Leonard and Stephanie together.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t think you can.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, why not?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look at Leonard’s record. 27 days with Joyce Kim.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: During which she defected to North Korea.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Two booty calls with Leslie Winkle.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: For which she awarded him the nickname “speed of light Leonard.”

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And a three hour dinner with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Which would have been two and a half if they ordered the souffle when they sat down.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Based on the geometric progression, his relationship with Stephanie should have ended after 20 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, I’m aware of the math, Y equals 27 days over 12 to the nth, the issue remains, how do we circumvent his inevitable rejection?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, if you want to guarantee his appeal to Stephanie, your best bet would be to kill all the other men on the planet.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll tell you what you shouldn’t do. Don’t spritz him with that body spray from the commercial where the women undress when they smell it, that doesn’t work at all, no matter how much you put on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, that’s all you’ve got? Apocalyptic genocide and go easy on the cologne?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (Knock, knock, knock)
utterance.content: Penny Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (Knock, knock, knock)
utterance.content: Penny. Zucchini bread.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: May I come in?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I see. Apparently my earlier inquiry regarding you and Leonard crossed some sort of line. I apologize.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, have you and I returned to a social equilibrium?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great. New topic. Where are you in your menstrual cycle?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve been doing some research online, and apparently female primates, you know, uh, apes, chimpanzees, you, they find their mate more desirable when he’s being courted by another female. Now, this effect is intensified when the rival female is secreting the pheromones associated with ovulation. Which brings me back to my question, where are you in . Clearly, I’m 14 days too early.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All I’m saying is if they can cure yellow fever and malaria, why can’t they do something about lactose intolerance?

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Leonard, you’re going to have to let this go. You had a little cheese dip, you farted, I thought it was cute.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, hi Stephanie.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Want some more wine?

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Yeah, I assume I’m not driving anywhere tonight. .

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have a craving for white asparagus that apparently is destined to go unsatisfied.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me. What the hell is wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m helping you with Stephanie.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: By making constipated moose sounds?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When I fail to open this jar and you succeed it will establish you as the alpha male. You see, when a female witnesses an exhibition of physical domination she produces the hormone oxytocin. If the two of you then engage in intercourse this will create the biochemical reaction in the brain which lay people naively interpret as falling in love.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Huh? Would it work if I just punched you in the face?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, actually it would, but let’s see how the lid goes. I’m not strong enough, Leonard, you’ll have to do it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, for god’s sakes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Go ahead, it’s pre-loosened.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Do you want some help with that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, no, I got it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, yeah, yeah, he’s got it, and that’s not surprising. This is something I long ago came to peace with in my role as the beta male. Open it.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Oh my god, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I’m not. I’m bleeding.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Like a gladiator!

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Oh, honey, you’re going to need stitches.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stitches? With a needle?

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Well, yeah, I mean, just a few.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, okay, yeah, hang on a sec.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: FYI, I was defrosting a steak in there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What a beautiful job Stephanie did. I might have gone with a mattress suture instead of a blanket stitch, but you can’t argue with her results. It’s a shame it won’t scar, the war wound is a time-honoured badge of masculinity.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t remember a time when you weren’t talking.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Just for the record, my efforts to establish you as the alpha male were not aided by you bursting into tears.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I did not burst into tears, my eyes just got a little watery.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Watery?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: She stuck a needle into my hand!

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Hey, how’s my big cry baby?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t cry.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Okay, I’m just teasing you. But, yeah, you did. Alright, it’s all good. what do you say we get you home and put you to bed?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, are you still going to spend the night?

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Uh, no, I think that you probably need to rest.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She’s right, as long as you’re vomiting, coitus is contra-indicated.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you, Dr. Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re welcome, Dr. Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Okay, I’m going to go get your discharge papers.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (after Sheldon tuts)
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you seem like a perfectly pleasant person. I just can’t understand why women have such a hard time loving you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, can you open this for me?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can I see your stitches?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure. .

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Answering the question once and for all why Wolowitz bailed out of medical school.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Leonard, congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What for?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Your facebook status update. Leonard Hofstadter is in a relationship.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What? no. no, that’s not right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, man, did you switch your status before she did? Speaking as an expert, way to look needy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Seriously? You went first, after only two weeks? That’s bold.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not bold, it’s a mistake. I didn’t change my status.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, then who did?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I had no choice, he cried in front of her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You hacked my facebook account?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, it’s hardly hacking when you use the same password for everything, Kal-el.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you insane? Now she’s going to think I’m desperate. You’ve destroyed this relationship! And you want to know what the worst part is? You don’t even understand what you did wrong because you can’t conceive of something that you are not an expert in!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In which I am not an expert.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t even! I don’t want to hear another word out of you.

utterance.speaker: Penny (after Raj lets out a noise)
utterance.content: What’s wrong, Lassie? Timmy fall down the well? Oh, wow. She just updated her facebook status.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stephanie Barnett is in a relationship with Leonard Hofstadter.”

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? Oh, look at that, I have a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If I am permitted to speak again, Dr. Sheldon Cooper for the win.
